quotes.quoteText: If I were two-faced, would I be wearing this one?
So long as men worship dictators, Caesars and Napoleons will arise to make them miserable.
Revolution, n. In politics, an abrupt change in the form of misgovernment.
Every country gets the Government it deserves.
The great thing about Democracy is that it gives every voter a chance to do something stupid.
It is better to own 10% of an elephant than 100% of a rat.
Every nation ridicules other nations, and all are right.
I was only an aspiring dictator. I was never a real dictator.
I'm looking at them from above, because God put me here.
My face is sour. Maybe that's why they say I'm a dictator.
Not a single leaf moves in this country if I'm not the one moving it. I want that to be clear!
My idea of an agreeable person is a person who agrees with me.
Now I know what a statesman is; he's a dead politician. We need more statesmen.
Corruption is like a ball of snow, once it's set a rolling it must increase.
I have come to the conclusion that politics are too serious a matter to be left to the politicians.
I remain just one thing, and one thing only - and that is a clown. It places me on a far higher plane than any politician.
I am not a liberator. Liberators do not exist. The people liberate themselves.
I am not Christ or a philanthropist, old lady, I am all the contrary of a Christ...

Government is too big and too important to be left to the politicians.
Politics is made up largely of irrelevancies.
If you are not criticized, you may not be doing much.
Take care of the luxuries and the necessities will take care of themselves.
Any man who wants to be president is either an egomaniac or crazy.
Democracy is the recurrent suspicion that more than half of the people are right more than half the time.
The public will believe anything, so long as it is not founded the truth.
Of what good is Democracy if it is not for the poor?
Ideas do not need weapons.
If surviving assassination attempts was an Olympic event, I would win the gold medal
This country is heaven, in the spiritual sense of the word. And I say, we prefer to die in heaven than survive in hell.
I don't have to be nice to people who are causing great damage to the nation...
Get all the fools on your side and you can be elected to anything.
We'd all like to vote for the best man, but he's never a candidate.
In politics, nothing happens by accident. If it happens, it was planned that way.
Every revolution evaporates and leaves behind only the slime of a new bureaucracy.
The truth is more important than the facts.
Idealism is fine, but as it approaches reality the cost becomes prohibitive.
One does not establish a dictatorship in order to safeguard a revolution; one makes a revolution in order to establish a dictatorship.
A dictatorship would be a heck of a lot easier, there's no question about it.
It's a recession when your neighbor loses his job; it's a depression when you lose yours.
When you have an efficient government, you have a dictatorship.
Some circumstantial evidence is very strong, as when you find a trout in the milk.
I don't see why we need to stand by and watch a country go communist due to the irresponsibility of its people.
Ninety percent of the politicians give the other ten percent a bad reputation.
There cannot be a crisis next week. My schedule is already full.
The day before yesterday I thought I was going to have to go to the extreme of decreeing a national emergency, but today I don't think I will have to.
The problem with political jokes is they get elected.
Sometimes people mistake the way I talk for what I am thinking.
I did not have three thousand pairs of shoes, I had one thousand and sixty.
Win or lose, we go shopping after the election.
Great causes and little men go ill together.
The international community wants us to accept a proposal that, if we were to accept, would mean the end to the opposition.
Thirty-two coups d'Etats are enough.
Fear is the foundation of most governments.
Justice is incidental to law and order.
We are a fact-gathering organization only. We don't clear anybody. We don't condemn anybody.
And so, my fellow Americans, ask not what your country can do for you; ask what you can do for your country.
Mankind must put an end to war or war will put an end to mankind.
Under Capitalism, man exploits man. Under communism, it's just the opposite.
Power corrupts. Absolute power is kind of neat.
If mankind minus one were of one opinion, then mankind is no more justified in silencing the one than the one - if he had the power - would be justified in silencing mankind.
Ideas are more powerful than guns. We would not let our enemies have guns, why should we let them have ideas?
Communism is like one big phone company.
Money can't buy happiness, but neither can poverty.
Not believing in force is the same as not believing in gravity.
The end may justify the means as long as there is something that justifies the end.
The trouble with free elections is you never know who is going to win.
Politics is the skilled use of blunt objects.
The danger is not that a particular class is unfit to govern. Every class is unfit to govern.
We thank God that our enemies are idiots.
Being powerful is like being a lady. If you have to tell people you are, you aren't.
Again and again we must rise to the majestic heights of meeting physical force with soul force.
There is a serious tendency towards Capitalism among the well-to-do peasants.
To read too many books is harmful.
Governments never learn. Only people learn.
This is genuine Democracy, but realistically the strong always rule.
If I could do it all again, I'd be a farmer.
If you want to steal, steal a little in a nice way. But if you steal too much to become rich overnight, you'll be caught.

A leader is a dealer in hope.
In politics, absurdity is not a handicap.

Revolutions are frightening, but election campaigns are disgusting.
Revolutions are frightening, but election campaigns are disgusting.Politics have no relation to morals.

Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much.
The secret of life is to appreciate the pleasure of being terribly, terribly deceived.

Turn on to politics, or politics will turn on you.
